translation.en: [Connie] I, Constance Reid, take you, Clifford Chatterley,
translation.de: Ich, Constance Reid, nehme dich, Clifford Chatterley,

translation.en: to be my lawfully wedded husband,
to have and to hold from this day forward, for better and for worse,
translation.de: Ich verspreche dir Treue in guten wie in schlechten Zeiten,

translation.en: for richer and for poorer,
in sickness and in health.
-[Connie laughing] -[Hilda] How does it feel? -I don't know. Ask me tomorrow. -[Hilda laughs]
translation.de: -Wie fühlt es sich an? -Ich weiß nicht. Frag mich morgen.

translation.en: -[Hilda] You need to eat something. -I need to get out of this dress.
translation.de: -Du musst was essen. -Ich muss aus dem Kleid raus.

translation.en: How do I look?
Well, I doubt Clifford will want to stay long at the reception.
translation.de: Clifford wird nicht lange auf der Feier bleiben wollen.

translation.en: You don't think his mother would've approved?
translation.de: Glaubst du, seine Mutter fände es gut?

translation.en: Well, I'm not entirely sure I do.
translation.de: Ich weiß nicht, ob ich es tue.

translation.en: Are we talking about the dress now, Hilda, -or the wedding? -[lips smacking]
translation.de: Reden wir über das Kleid oder die Hochzeit, Hilda?

translation.en: He goes back to the front in the morning. Imagine if we'd left it,
translation.de: Er fährt morgen an die Front. Was, wenn wir es nicht tun und etwas Schlimmes passiert?

translation.en: and then something terrible happened.
translation.de: Was, wenn wir es nicht tun und etwas Schlimmes passiert?

translation.en: -Couldn't you have just had sex with him? -Hilda! Be serious.
translation.de: -Warum hattest du nicht einfach Sex? -Hilda! Im Ernst.

translation.en: I am. It's much less commitment, and it's all Clifford will want anyway.
translation.de: Ja. Du wärst frei, und Clifford wird sowieso nur das wollen.

translation.en: Clifford's not like that.
You know him. He's kind and thoughtful. He makes me feel safe.
translation.de: Du kennst ihn. Er ist lieb und umsichtig. Er gibt mir Sicherheit.

translation.en: His family's more traditional than ours, I suppose,
translation.de: Seine Familie ist traditioneller als unsere,

translation.en: but I think his own views are actually quite progressive.
-[Hilda] Really? -Yes.
-Does he know about that German boy? -Yes. And he says it doesn't matter.
translation.de: -Weiß er von deinem Deutschen? -Ja. Es ist ihm egal.

translation.en: It was before the war, so it doesn't count.
translation.de: Das war vor dem Krieg, das zählt nicht.

translation.en: [Hilda] You don't need to convince me. I had my own German boy, remember?
translation.de: Schon gut. Ich hatte meinen eigenen Deutschen.

translation.en: Well, mine's dead.
-[sighs] -You see, that's just it.
-What? -[sighs] I don't want to see you get hurt again.
translation.de: -Was? -Ich will dich nicht wieder leiden sehen.

translation.en: You, uh… You open your
heart so easily.
Oh, Hilda!
-Clifford! -Hmm, reinforcements have arrived.
You read my mind.
[chuckles] I nearly drank yours on the way up.
-[Clifford] Cheers. -Cheers.
Well, what now? [Clifford] Our fathers are preparing their toasts.
translation.de: -Was jetzt? -Unsere Väter bereiten ihre Toasts vor.

translation.en: Can we face them together? [Clifford] Of course.
You look stunning, Con.
Thanks.
[Clifford] Are you ready?
-So, here's to Clifford and Connie… -[tapping on glass]
…our new hope for an heir to Wragby. [laughs]
translation.de: unsere neue Hoffnung auf einen Erben für Wragby.

translation.en: [all] To Clifford and Connie. Father, that's not just why we married.
translation.de: -Auf Clifford und Connie. -Vater, das ist nicht der einzige Grund.

translation.en: No, why else would a baronet get married?
translation.de: Warum würde ein Baronet sonst heiraten?

translation.en: -I married because I found Connie. -And I you.
translation.de: -Weil ich Connie gefunden habe. -Und ich dich.

translation.en: We would like to thank those who donated their butter and sugar rations
translation.de: Ein Dank an alle, die ihre Butter- und Zuckerrationen

translation.en: to help us celebrate.
To the next heir of Chatterley.
-[guests] To the Chatterleys! -[glasses clinking]
Oh God. "Why else is a baronet ever married?"
translation.de: Oh Gott. "Warum würde ein Baronet sonst heiraten?"

translation.en: Unbelievable. [scoffs]
Do you want children, Clifford?
Uh, yeah. Yeah, someday.
-For our sake, not for my father's. -Hmm.
Assuming you would.
I think so, yes.
What? You all right?
Yes, um, of course. Sorry. Uh…
It's just, um…
I can't stop thinking about going back to the front.
translation.de: Ich muss immer an die Front denken.

translation.en: -I… I know I'll be all right. -You will be.
-We don't have to do anything. -No, no, I… I want to.
Sure you don't want me to come to the station?
translation.de: Soll ich nicht mit zum Bahnhof?

translation.en: [Clifford] Thanks.
Let's not make a ceremony of it, shall we?
translation.de: Machen wir daraus keine Zeremonie, ok?

translation.en: I love you, Con.
Bye.
I look forward to your letters.
I'll write to you every day.
[Connie] Dearest Hilda, I knew the war would change us all,
translation.de: Liebste Hilda, ich wusste, der Krieg würde uns verändern,

translation.en: but I just wasn't sure how much.
It feels as though it ended half a lifetime ago,
translation.de: Er scheint eine Ewigkeit her zu sein,

translation.en: not just half a year.
We've already moved away from London.
We've just arrived at Wragby,
translation.de: Wir kamen gestern auf Wragby an,

translation.en: Clifford's family estate.
Once we're settled in, I expect to write to you often.
translation.de: Wenn wir uns eingelebt haben, schreibe ich dir oft.

translation.en: Your loving sister, Connie.
[Connie] Thank you.
[Mrs. Warren] Welcome home, Sir Clifford. We've been praying for you.
translation.de: Willkommen, Sir Clifford. Wir beteten für Euch.

translation.en: Thank you, Mr. Warren.
[Connie] All right.
Thank you. I can, uh… I can manage.
Mr. and Mrs. Warren, this is my wife,
translation.de: Mr. und Mrs. Warren, das ist meine Frau.

translation.en: the new Lady Chatterley. It's so nice to meet you, milady.
There's plenty of work to be done.
Hire back all the workers we can, Mrs. Warren.
translation.de: Stellen Sie alle Arbeiter wieder an.

translation.en: Old girl's seen better days. [Connie chuckles] We'll bring her back to life.
translation.de: -Dem Haus ging es schon besser. -Wir erwecken es zum Leben.

translation.en: We thought you might like to use your father's study as the master bedroom,
translation.de: Das Arbeitszimmer Eures Vaters ist das Schlafzimmer,

translation.en: so you don't have to bother with the stairs.
[chuckles] Thank you, Mrs. Warren.
No.
No, let's put the luggage in here.
We'll use the library as a master.
What is more inspiring for a writer than to sleep among books?
translation.de: Unter Bücher zu schlafen inspiriert einen Autor.

translation.en: This is where they found Father. They say his heart gave out.
translation.de: Hier fanden sie Vater. Sein Herz hat schlappgemacht.

translation.en: I think he died of chagrin.
Clifford… it's all done now.
Life is what we make of it. [chuckles]
-Mrs. Warren. -Yes.
Let's open the curtains, let some light in.
[Mrs. Warren] Of course, milady.
-[Clifford] We should have a look around. -I will.
You're welcome to use the private room above the library
translation.de: Nimm das Zimmer über der Bibliothek,

translation.en: with the family portraits.
You can have the whole of the second floor.
translation.de: Oder gleich die ganze erste Etage.

translation.en: Welcome home, Clifford.
You all right? I've got you. Lean on me, put your weight on me.
translation.de: Alles gut? Ich hab dich. Stütz dich auf mich.

translation.en: -[Clifford grunts] Ready? -Mm-hmm. Yes. [exclaims]
I'm getting the hang of it. [sighs]
-Love it. -Mmm.
[Clifford sighs] You know, um…
I'm thinking of expanding the short story I wrote in Cambridge.
-Hmm? -Turning it into a novel.
-It's a wonderful idea. -You think?
-You'll be my editor? -Of course.
Proofreader, typist. I'll submit my application.
I'll get you to the top of the pile.
-All right? -Yes.
-Ooh, this bed is softer than I thought. -[both chuckle]
translation.de: Das Bett ist weicher, als ich dachte.

translation.en: -First night at Wragby. Hmm. -Welcome.
-Oh, sorry. -Oh, you're fine. Really.
What?
I'm sorry, Con.
I just can't anymore, you know?
I'm so sorry.
It's all right. Don't worry.
You'll be fine?
Yes.
[whispering] I love you, Con.
This is misfortune, but you'll see.
We… We'll be happy here
translation.de: Aber wir werden hier glücklich sein.

translation.en: at Wragby.
Hello, sir.
I'm a strong, hardworking man, and I will not let you down.
translation.de: Ich bin stark und fleißig und enttäusche Sie nicht.

translation.en: Lily Wheedon. My mum worked for Sir Geoffrey.
translation.de: Lily Wheedon. Meine Mutter arbeitete für Sir Geoffrey.

translation.en: Really?
You, uh, worked for my father before the war.
translation.de: Sie arbeiteten vor dem Krieg für meinen Vater.

translation.en: Aye, sir.
-And you were an army lieutenant. -I was, sir.
Do you honestly believe that a return to gamekeeping
translation.de: Sie glauben, die Arbeit als Wildhüter

translation.en: will be satisfying after your time as an officer?
translation.de: wird Sie nach Ihrer Zeit als Offizier erfüllen?

translation.en: Bit of quiet'd do me good.
-I've seen enough of what war does to men. -[Clifford] Hmm.
translation.de: Ich weiß, was der Krieg aus Männern macht.

translation.en: As have I.
You must know your way around the estate better than I do.
translation.de: Sie kennen sich hier wohl besser als ich aus.

translation.en: [Lily] Oh, no, milady. I couldn't visit while she was working.
translation.de: Nein, Mylady. Ich durfte sie nicht besuchen.

translation.en: Very well then. Welcome back, Mr. Mellors.
translation.de: Na schön. Willkommen zurück, Mr. Mellors.

translation.en: [Oliver] Sir.
[Connie] In that case, we'll have to learn our way around together. Won't we?
translation.de: Dann werden wir hier alles zusammen entdecken.

translation.en: -[Lily] Hmm. -Thank you, Lily.
My name is Kelly Martin, milady.
-Thank you. -I've been a maid for five years.
[Connie] Dear Hilda,
I'm a thoughtless lout for not writing sooner.
translation.de: ich hätte dir längst schreiben sollen.

translation.en: In my defense, Wragby needed an enormous amount of tending to.
translation.de: Aber auf Wragby gab es ungeheuer viel zu tun.

translation.en: But we finally have a full staff who've done wonders in restoring the place.
translation.de: Wir haben endlich Personal, das hier wahre Wunder vollbracht hat.

translation.en: Clifford's strength has returned.
I'm still the only one he's willing to let help him,
translation.de: Ich bin immer noch die Einzige, die ihm helfen darf,

translation.en: but every day, he can do more and more on his own.
translation.de: aber mit jedem Tag wird er selbstständiger.

translation.en: He's writing, all the time,
which keeps his spirits up, and he's nearly finished his first novel.
translation.de: was ihn bei Laune hält. Sein erster Roman ist bald fertig.

translation.en: [Clifford] "I first met Mrs. Gertrude at a dinner, comma,
-thrown by Lord Witherby." -[typewriter clacking]
"With the sort of fellow, whom--" I'm quite pleased with this…
translation.de: "Mit der Sorte Mann, die…" Das gefällt mir gut…

translation.en: -"The sort of fellow…" -[Connie] It is quiet here in the country.
translation.de: Es ist ruhig hier auf dem Lande.

translation.en: I miss the life we had in London,
translation.de: Ich vermisse unser Leben in London

translation.en: and, of course, I miss you.
But we have to live, I suppose,
no matter how many skies have fallen.
[Connie] We have had some guests.
Mostly Clifford's old bachelor friends.
It's hardly surprising that most of them haven't found women, believe me.
translation.de: Es überrascht kaum, dass die meisten keine Frau haben.

translation.en: Now and again, we also get visits from writers
translation.de: Ab und zu besuchen uns Schriftsteller,

translation.en: whose advice Clifford has sought out.
Apparently, my old friends all seem to think misfortune is contagious.
translation.de: Meine alten Freunde denken offenbar, Unglück sei ansteckend.

translation.en: I know you and Owen have been traveling everywhere since the war ended,
translation.de: Ich weiß, Du und Owen reist seit Kriegsende umher,

translation.en: but once you've settled back home, I would so love to see you.
translation.de: aber wenn du wieder zu Hause bist, möchte ich dich sehen.

translation.en: -Am I interrupting? -[Clifford] No, not at all.
I was thinking about going to London for a few days
translation.de: Ich möchte ein paar Tage nach London,

translation.en: to visit Hilda.
Leaving me to fend for myself?
[chuckles] We do have a house full of servants.
translation.de: Wir haben ein Haus voller Diener.

translation.en: I don't need servants. I need you.
Why don't you invite Hilda? She'd be more than welcome.
translation.de: Warum lädst du Hilda nicht ein?

translation.en: I have. She can't get away from London for a few weeks.
translation.de: Hab ich. Sie kann die nächsten Wochen nicht aus London weg.

translation.en: Hmm. I'm glad at least she can come.
I'm going to go for a walk.
[Clifford] Why? We can send Mrs. Warren out for anything you might need.
translation.de: Warum? Schick Mrs. Warren, falls du was brauchst.

translation.en: I don't need anything, Clifford. I just want to go for a walk.
translation.de: Ich brauche nichts, Clifford. Ich will nur spazieren gehen.

translation.en: Very well, dear.
-As you like. -Jesus.
-[whistling nearby] -Hello.
[Oliver] Flossie! Come here, lass.
[Oliver] Come on.
Good girl. Good girl.
I wandered further down and I found this stream running right through the woods.
translation.de: Ich ging weiter und fand einen Bach im Wald.

translation.en: [grunts] I, uh, think I know the place. Doubt I'd be able to get there anymore.
translation.de: Ich kenne den Ort. Da komme ich wohl nicht mehr hin.

translation.en: I'm sure we can find a way if you wanted to go.
translation.de: Es gibt sicher einen Weg, wenn du willst.

translation.en: -Right. -Perhaps.
Here we are.
-Ready? -Yes.
All right.
[groans] It's fine.
-It's all right? -Yes.
Uh, I don't want you to drop me.
I'm not going to drop you. Look, just, um…
There we go.
There we are. That's fine. Just let me go there.
translation.de: Ja. Das ist gut. Jetzt kannst du loslassen.

translation.en: Thank you. Thank you.
[grunts] Ah. There. -See, you didn't need my help at all. -[panting, chuckles]
-There must be times you hate me for this. -No.
I wouldn't blame you.
There are days I wish I hadn't made it back.
translation.de: Manchmal wünschte ich, ich wäre gestorben.

translation.en: Don't talk like that.
I'd be lost without you, Con. You know that.
Let's open some windows, get some fresh air in here.
translation.de: Ich lasse etwas frische Luft rein.

translation.en: I've never seen the sky so clear.
Yes, well, there's no smoke in the air. Mines are closed for May Day.
translation.de: Es ist kein Rauch da. Die Zechen sind am Ersten Mai zu.

translation.en: You should go down to Tevershall.
See the fair. You can, you know?
translation.de: Zum Fest. Das kannst du ruhig.

translation.en: Just be back in time for tea.
-Yes, I might. -Hmm.
-[man] Nice to see you, Lady Chatterley. -[woman] Milady.
It's nice to meet you, Lady Chatterley.
Oh, that's so kind.
Thank you.
Happy May Day to you, milady.
Happy May Day.
Who's this? She's precious.
translation.de: Wer ist das? Sie ist wunderbar.

translation.en: -This is my Josephine. -Hi, Josephine.
Say hello to Lady Chatterley.
I seem to be having that effect on people today.
translation.de: Heute reagieren alle so auf mich.

translation.en: I'm Mrs. Flint. I'm a schoolteacher here in the village.
translation.de: Ich bin Mrs. Flint. Ich bin Lehrerin hier im Dorf.

translation.en: I'm Connie. Lovely to meet you.
My, uh… My husband leases Marehay Farm from your estate.
translation.de: Mein Mann mietet Marehay Farm von Eurem Anwesen.

translation.en: -Marehay Farm? -It's not far from where you are.
[chanting] Side by side we fight forever.
translation.de: Seite an Seite kämpfen wir. Gemeinsam halten wir sie auf.

translation.en: More in numbers makes them stop.
translation.de: Seite an Seite kämpfen wir. Gemeinsam halten wir sie auf. Solange wir zusammenhalten.

translation.en: Just as long as we stand together.
What was that?
[Mrs. Flint] The miners. They're out protesting again.
-Again? -[woman 1] Leave him!
Um, that, um… That happens a lot?
They must've been from one of the other mines.
translation.de: Sie sind wohl von einer anderen Zeche.

translation.en: They'd lose their jobs if they marched like that through their own village.
translation.de: Sie werden gefeuert, wenn sie in ihrem Dorf protestieren.

translation.en: Does it mean our miners from Tevershall protest in other villages?
translation.de: Bergmänner aus Tevershall protestieren also in anderen Dörfern?

translation.en: I wouldn't know.
I may teach their children,
but I'm an outsider when it comes to the miners' wives.
translation.de: aber für ihre Frauen bin ich eine Außenstehende.

translation.en: That makes two of us.
-[woman 2] Well, hello, Lady Chatterley. -Hello.
[Mrs. Flint] You should come to Marehay one day.
-We'd love to have you. -I'd love that.
Thank you.
Where are we going?
You've always wanted me to join you on one of your walks.
translation.de: Du wolltest immer, dass ich mitkomme.

translation.en: I thought of somewhere I'd like to show you.
-Don't think your chair was made for this. -[chuckles]
Ah, Mellors. Give us a hand trying to get this chair started again.
translation.de: Mellors. Würden Sie uns mit dem Rollstuhl helfen?

translation.en: Yes, sir.
Uh, Connie, have you met Mellors, our new gamekeeper?
Get down, you, Floss.
She's just being friendly. [chuckles]
Now, then.
You've been at Wragby sometime, Mr. Mellors?
translation.de: Sind Sie schon lange auf Wragby?

translation.en: I was raised here, Your Ladyship.
translation.de: Ich bin hier aufgewachsen, Eure Ladyschaft.

translation.en: [Connie] Need some help?
[grunts] Mellors is quite capable of pushing on his own. There we are.
translation.de: Mellors kann allein schieben. Na also.

translation.en: -Now… Now, now. -[grunts]
Nothing else, sir?
Nothing else. Good day.
[Connie] That was kind of you. Hope it wasn't too heavy.
translation.de: Wie gütig von Ihnen. Ich hoffe, er war nicht zu schwer.

translation.en: No, not heavy.
Good day to you, Your Ladyship.
[Clifford] I used to come here as a lad, sit for hours. One of the finest views in all the Midlands.
translation.de: Ich kam als Junge hierher. Die beste Aussicht der Midlands.

translation.en: I want to restore these woods.
If these places aren't preserved, there'll be no England left.
translation.de: Wir müssen diese Orte hegen, sonst verschwindet England.

translation.en: Our way of life will end, never mind what we gave up to defend it.
translation.de: Und unsere Lebensart, für die wir viel geopfert haben.

translation.en: I mind not being able to have a son here more than any other place.
translation.de: Es schmerzt, dass ich hier keinen Sohn haben kann.

translation.en: I'm sorry we can't have one.
Almost be a good thing if you had a son by another man.
translation.de: Du könntest ihn von einem anderen bekommen.

translation.en: You're not serious?
-Why not? -Why not? Because…
Because we're married.
I married you, Clifford.
Why would you even suggest such a thing?
translation.de: Wieso schlägst du so was vor?

translation.en: You've told me how much you'd love a child.
translation.de: Du sagtest, du möchtest ein Kind.

translation.en: This way, you could have one to dote on, to fill your days.
translation.de: Du könntest es vergöttern, deine Tage damit füllen.

translation.en: As far as anyone else knows, I might still be capable of fathering a child.
translation.de: Man hält mich ja für zeugungsfähig.

translation.en: If we raised him here at Wragby, he'd be ours.
translation.de: Wir würden es auf Wragby großziehen.

translation.en: Do you really mean this?
Well, of course, I wouldn't want you to yield yourself completely to him,
translation.de: Natürlich sollst du dich ihm nicht völlig hingeben,

translation.en: but the mechanical act of sex is nothing when compared to a life lived together.
translation.de: aber der reine Geschlechtsakt ist nichts im Vergleich zu einer Ehe.

translation.en: If you govern your emotions accordingly, we could arrange this like a trip to the dentist.
translation.de: Solange du deine Gefühle zügelst, wäre das wie ein Besuch beim Zahnarzt.

translation.en: A trip to the… [scoffs]
And you wouldn't mind what man's child I had?
translation.de: Und dir wäre egal, wessen Kind es wäre?

translation.en: I trust your judgment. You wouldn't let the wrong sort of fellow touch you.
translation.de: Ich vertraue deinem Urteil. Du lässt nicht den Falschen ran.

translation.en: Someone of the utmost discretion. The Chatterley name depends on it.
translation.de: Er müsste diskret sein. Unser Name hängt davon ab.

translation.en: Would you expect me to tell you who this man was?
translation.de: Wirst du wissen wollen, wer er ist?

translation.en: Best I don't know.
An heir really means this much to you?
translation.de: So wichtig ist dir ein Erbe, ja?

translation.en: It means a lot to the people here.
translation.de: Er bedeutet den Leuten hier viel.

translation.en: I know you can do it for them and for the Chatterleys.
translation.de: Du kannst es für sie tun und für die Chatterleys.

translation.en: You do agree with me, don't you?
translation.de: Du stimmst mir doch zu, ja?

translation.en: I'm going ahead.
They're all talking about your book in London. It's good work.
translation.de: In London ist Euer Buch in aller Munde. Gute Arbeit.

translation.en: You really think so? I wanted to write something special.
translation.de: Finden Sie? Ich wollte etwas Besonderes schreiben.

translation.en: Not just popular, but something really first class.
translation.de: Es sollte nicht nur beliebt, sondern wirklich gut sein.

translation.en: The entire pals collective across the entire northeast,
keeping them together, making sure they've got all of--
So sorry. Will you excuse me? Just for a second?
translation.de: Entschuldigen Sie mich bitte? Ganz kurz.

translation.en: Uh, yes. Um…
You imagine they've solved the world's problems yet?
translation.de: Werden hier die Probleme der Welt gelöst?

translation.en: [chuckles] I'm sure they think they have.
Shame they've forgotten their solutions by daybreak.
translation.de: Leider ist bis morgen alles vergessen.

translation.en: You're a writer. Maybe you should take notes.
translation.de: Sie sind Schriftsteller. Machen Sie Notizen.

translation.en: I doubt I'd be welcome in that drinking circle.
translation.de: Die wollen mich nicht in ihrem Kreis.

translation.en: Don't worry. I'm not really a part of this world, either.
translation.de: Keine Sorge. Ich bin auch nicht Teil dieser Welt.

translation.en: -Oh, but you grew up in it, didn't you? -Hardly. My father's an artist.
translation.de: -Aber Ihr seid in ihr aufgewachsen. -Kaum. Mein Vater ist Künstler.

translation.en: So I grew up between rented villas and woke up each morning to the smell of turpentine.
translation.de: Ich wuchs in gemieteten Villen auf und erwachte mit dem Geruch von Terpentin.

translation.en: Sounds like quite the Bohemian lifestyle.
There must be days when you don't feel like a lady at all.
translation.de: Es gibt bestimmt Tage, wenn Ihr Euch nicht wie eine Lady fühlt.

translation.en: I head back home in the morning. With luck, he'd invite me to visit again.
translation.de: Ich fahre morgen früh heim. Vielleicht lädt er mich noch mal ein.

translation.en: That's the last time we'll invite the Irish playwright.
translation.de: Wir laden den irischen Dramatiker nicht mehr ein.

translation.en: -Michaelis? -Hmm.
He writes well, he knows how to dress,
translation.de: Er schreibt gut, zieht sich schick an,

translation.en: but he's got the manners of a Dublin street rat.
translation.de: hat aber die Manieren einer Ratte aus Dublin.

translation.en: Maybe because he knows he's only around as long as people deem him useful.
translation.de: Vielleicht, weil er weiß, dass man ihn nur benutzt.

translation.en: We all know where we stand.
You ought to eat something. You're wasting away.
translation.de: Iss was. Du wirst immer dünner.

translation.en: -I'm not feeling well. -Hmm? Mmm.
I haven't been feeling well since our conversation.
[Clifford chuckles] Here we are, look!
I got my picture in the paper.
[clears throat] Hmm. Chatterley's novella has garnered attention
for its humorous analysis of people and their motives,
though his views on modern society are not young and playful,
translation.de: doch seine Ansichten zur Moderne sind nicht frisch und verspielt,

translation.en: but curiously old and obscenely conceited."
translation.de: sondern seltsam alt und unflätig arrogant."

translation.en: -Clifford, stop reading. -"A wonderful display of nothingness."
translation.de: -Hör auf zu lesen. -"Eine wunderbare Darstellung des Nichts."

translation.en: It's just one review.
But they're right.
They… they've seen right through me.
It's all nothing.
A home, love, sex, marriage, friendship, all of it.

translation.de: Er hasste es, aber was sollte er tun? Er war gefangen.

translation.en: I suppose we all are in different ways.
translation.de: Das sind wir alle auf irgendeine Art.

translation.en: You never wanted to remarry? -Oh, Lord. -[both chuckle]
Ted was the only one? He was.
But you and your man, you know, you grow together.
translation.de: Aber man wächst mit seinem Mann zusammen.

translation.en: Who else is there in life?
translation.de: Wen hat man sonst im Leben?

translation.en: Children, of course, but… Oh.
-I'm sorry, that was thoughtless of me. -No. Don't worry. It's fine.
translation.de: -Tut mir leid, wie rücksichtslos. -Nein. Macht nichts. Schon gut.

translation.en: More than fine, actually.
There still might be some hope in that regard.
-For you and Sir Clifford? -Hmm.
Doctor says his recovery is remarkable.
translation.de: Der Arzt sagt, er erholt sich prächtig.

translation.en: So who knows? I might have a child yet.
translation.de: Also, wer weiß? Vielleicht kommt ein Kind.

translation.en: Well, I hope and pray that you do.
translation.de: Das hoffe ich und ich bete dafür.

translation.en: Can I get you a blanket?
No, I'm fine, thank you.
Sleep well. Save some secrets for our next conversation.
translation.de: Schlafen Sie gut. Bis zur nächsten Unterhaltung.

translation.en: Good night.
[inhales deeply] Come on now, you lass.
I think we're best off outside.
Come on.
-[groaning] -[Mrs. Bolton] There, there.
Has Her Ladyship not risen yet?
-She got up before I did. -Hmm.
She's already had her breakfast, then.
Yes. She's out on one of her walks.
I was up early myself.
There were a lot of people out this morn. [breathing heavily]
-The gamekeeper, he was-- -Could you get me some fresh cream?
-Yes, sir. -Thank you.
-[water splashing] -[woman 1] Since Sir Clifford took over,
they've been working the poor miners to the bone.
I thought the machines were supposed to make the work easier.
translation.de: Ich dachte, die Maschinen machen es einfacher.

translation.en: It's a way to make more money with fewer workers.
translation.de: Sie machen mit weniger Arbeitern mehr Geld.

translation.en: [woman 2] Don't he have enough money already?
Oh, bet his lady needs her baubles and silk
so she can lord her station over the rest of us.
translation.de: damit sie besser ist als wir.

translation.en: No, she's not like that.
She treats folks who work with her
with the same respect she'd treat a lord or lady.
translation.de: ebenso respektvoll wie einen Lord oder eine Lady.

translation.en: My Lily says the same about her.
translation.de: Meine Lily sagt dasselbe über sie.

translation.en: Well, she deserves better then. Such a hard lot that's fallen to her.
translation.de: -Dann verdient sie was Besseres. -Sie hat kein leichtes Los.

translation.en: Oh! As it happens, uh, Sir Clifford may not be quite as done in as we thought.
translation.de: Sir Clifford ist vielleicht nicht so am Ende, wie wir dachten.

translation.en: Oh, his legs won't work again, but, you know, rest might.
translation.de: Seine Beine funktionieren nicht, aber der Rest vielleicht schon.

translation.en: Her Ladyship has even suggested there might be a child one day soon.
translation.de: Ihre Ladyschaft hat angedeutet, dass bald ein Kind kommen könnte.

translation.en: What?
-No! -[chuckling]
-That's amazing. -You ever heard of such a thing?
[Clifford] How long should these things last?
[Mr. Linley] If we keep them in good repair, for generations.
translation.de: Wenn wir sie gut warten, wahrscheinlich Generationen.

translation.en: Speaking of which, sir, if you don't mind my asking,
translation.de: Apropos, Sir, wenn ich fragen darf,

translation.en: is there any truth to the rumor
that we may still have hope of an heir at Wragby?
translation.de: dass wir auf einen Erben für Wragby hoffen können?

translation.en: Are there rumors?
Yes.
Everyone's been asking me what I know about it.
translation.de: Alle fragen mich, was ich weiß.

translation.en: I am happy to set the record straight if the rumor's unfounded.
translation.de: Natürlich berichtige ich alle, wenn das Gerücht nicht stimmt.

translation.en: Indeed.
Well…
there may yet be hope.
Hello, Con.
I've just had the most interesting meeting with Mr. Linley.
translation.de: Ich hatte soeben ein interessantes Gespräch mit Mr. Linley.

translation.en: Have you heard the rumor that you are to supply Wragby with an heir?
translation.de: Hast du das Gerücht gehört, dass du Wragby einen Erben liefern sollst?

translation.en: No.
Is it a joke?
I'd hoped it might be a prophecy.
I received a letter from Father.
translation.de: Ich bekam einen Brief von Vater.

translation.en: He's been invited to Venice for July and August
translation.de: Er wurde für Juli und August nach Venedig eingeladen

translation.en: and has asked me and Hilda to come with him.
translation.de: und möchte, dass ich und Hilda mitkommen.

translation.en: July and August?
I wouldn't need to go for that long.
translation.de: Ich müsste nicht so lange weg.

translation.en: Three weeks should be more than enough time
for what we discussed.
Have plans already been set in motion?
translation.de: Ist der Plan bereits im Gange?

translation.en: Not just yet.
If I were absolutely certain you'd want to come back to me?
translation.de: Wäre es sicher, dass du zu mir zurückkommst?

translation.en: Of course I would.
I don't want to know his name.
No one can.
Well, in that case, I think it ought to be all right, don't you?
translation.de: In dem Fall sollte doch alles gut sein, oder?

translation.en: [Connie] You know how much you mean to me, don't you?
translation.de: Du weißt, was du mir bedeutest. Oder?

translation.en: And you to me.
I have to go away for a while.
-Where? -Venice.
With Sir Clifford?
-For how long? -Just a couple of months.
But no, not with Clifford.
He doesn't like to travel how he is.
Aye. The poor devil.
-You won't forget about me. -Forget?
-Mm-hmm. -You know nobody forgets.
It's not a question of memory.
Look, um…
I told Clifford I might have a child.
translation.de: Ich sagte Clifford, ich könnte ein Kind bekommen.

translation.en: You did?
I… I think I'm already… expecting.
translation.de: Ich glaube, ich bin bereits schwanger.

translation.en: What did he say?
He said he'd be glad
as long as the child seemed to be his.
translation.de: solange es seins zu sein scheint.

translation.en: So where does Sir Clifford suppose that this child is coming from?
translation.de: Wo, glaubt Sir Clifford, kommt das Kind her?

translation.en: -I said I might have an affair in Venice. -You might. So that's why you're going.
translation.de: -Von einer Affäre in Venedig. -Deshalb fährst du also hin.

translation.en: Not to have the affair. Just the appearance of one.
translation.de: Nicht wegen der Affäre. Um eine vorzutäuschen.

translation.en: So that's why you wanted me then. To get a child.
translation.de: Deshalb wolltest du mich. Um ein Kind zu bekommen.

translation.en: Of course not, Oliver.
I never planned on you. I never planned on any of this, really.
translation.de: Du warst nie geplant. Nichts hiervon war geplant.

translation.en: What was the plan then, Connie?
translation.de: Was war dann der Plan, Connie?

translation.en: What was the plan, really?
-What was the plan? -I--
-I don't know. -You don't know?
Well, then, I am damned if I do.
translation.de: Na, ich weiß es ganz sicher nicht.

translation.en: Fucking hell.
Well, it's as Your Ladyship likes.
If you get a child, Sir Clifford's welcome to it.
translation.de: Du bekommst das Kind für Sir Clifford.

translation.en: I shan't have lost anything.
translation.de: Ich habe nichts verloren. Im Gegenteil.

translation.en: On the contrary, I've had a nice experience.
translation.de: Ich habe nichts verloren. Im Gegenteil. -Es war eine schöne Erfahrung. -Red nicht so.

translation.en: -Don't talk like that. -If you've made use of me,
translation.de: -Es war eine schöne Erfahrung. -Red nicht so. Es ist nicht das erste Mal, dass man mich benutzt.

translation.en: it's not the first time I've been made use of, is it?
translation.de: Es ist nicht das erste Mal, dass man mich benutzt.

translation.en: I don't suppose it's ever been as pleasant as this time.
translation.de: Und so angenehm war es noch nie.

translation.en: Of course, one can't feel tremendously dignified about it.
translation.de: Natürlich ist es nicht sehr würdevoll.

translation.en: I didn't make use of you… Oliver.
translation.de: Ich habe dich nicht benutzt, Oliver.

translation.en: As Your Ladyship pleases.
-You forgot your book. -[door slams]
Or have you made use of that as well?
translation.de: Oder hast du das auch benutzt?

translation.en: With the new generators, we'll be able to reduce the workforce.
translation.de: Mit den neuen Generatoren brauchen wir weniger Arbeiter.

translation.en: -Striking will be impossible. -What about the workers?
No man's forced to work for me. I'm not forced to hire them.
translation.de: Ich zwinge niemanden, für mich zu arbeiten.

translation.en: -No wonder the men hate you. -They don't hate me.
translation.de: -Kein Wunder, dass sie dich hassen. -Tun sie nicht.

translation.en: They depend on me. They should be grateful.
They'd starve without someone to tend them.
You talk about them as if they're herd animals.
translation.de: Du redest über sie, als wären sie Tiere.

translation.en: Not all of them.
An individual may rise from the pack now and again.
translation.de: Ab und zu hebt sich mal einer hervor.

translation.en: Most of those men have been ruled since time began.
translation.de: Die meisten waren schon immer Untertanen.

translation.en: And you can rule them?
Yes, because I've been brought up and trained to do so.
translation.de: Ja, ich wurde dazu erzogen und ausgebildet.

translation.en: That's my role in society, as it's their place to serve.
translation.de: Ich habe meine Aufgabe, sie ihre.

translation.en: So there is no shared humanity between us?
translation.de: Wir haben also nichts mit ihnen gemein?

translation.en: We all need to eat and breathe, but beyond that, no.
translation.de: Wir müssen alle essen und atmen. Weiter nichts.

translation.en: Shall we go as far as the spring?
Good day to you, Mr. Mellors!
-[horn honking] -Ayuh.
Wait, Clifford. I'll push.
What's the use of the thing if she needs to be pushed?
translation.de: Wozu ist das Ding gut, wenn man es schieben muss?

translation.en: -[grunts] You're making it worse! -Be quiet a moment, will you?
translation.de: -Du machst es schlimmer! -Sei doch mal still.

translation.en: Damn thing!
-[grunts] -Wait, stop!
-[horn honks] -Mellors.
-Yes, Sir Clifford? -Know anything about blasted motors?
translation.de: -Ja, Sir Clifford? -Wissen Sie was über Motoren?

translation.en: -I'm afraid not. Has she gone wrong? -Apparently!
Just have a look and see that nothing's broken.
translation.de: Sehen Sie mal nach, ob was kaputt ist.

translation.en: No.
Seems all right as far as I can see, sir.
translation.de: Scheint mir alles in Ordnung, Sir.

translation.en: [Clifford] Then stand back.
-Maybe if I give it a push. -No. She'll do it herself.
Yeah?
-You see? Good. -[engine straining]
Are you pushing? I asked you not.
-It won't go if I don't. -Give it a chance, man!
translation.de: -Sonst fährt es nicht. -Geben Sie ihm eine Chance!

translation.en: Clifford, watch your brake.
-Right. Fine. -Clifford!
It's obvious I'm at everybody's bloody mercy.
translation.de: Ich bin offenbar auf jeden angewiesen.

translation.en: It would seem, Mr. Mellors, that she would need to be pushed.
translation.de: Es scheint, Mr. Mellors, dass ich angeschoben werden muss.

translation.en: Do you mind? -Not at all, sir. -Hmm.
Right.
-Hang on, hang on. -[grunts]
-Two, three. -[engine starts]
Bombs away.
-[Oliver grunts] -There we are.
For God's sake, man, what's the matter with you?
translation.de: Herrgott noch mal, was ist mit Ihnen los?

translation.en: Lungs are a bit knackered, sir. [coughs] Little souvenir from the war.
translation.de: Meine Lungen, Sir. Andenken aus dem Krieg.

translation.en: [Clifford] What the hell are you doing?
-He needs my help, Clifford! -[Clifford] God's sake.
You all right?
[Clifford] I suppose the other chair will need a new set of wheels.
translation.de: Der andere Stuhl braucht neue Räder.

translation.en: [Connie] Who do you think you are?
I mean, how can you treat someone like that?
translation.de: Wie kannst du jemanden so behandeln?

translation.en: [Clifford scoffs] Who? The gamekeeper?
He was injured in the war as well.
translation.de: Er wurde auch im Krieg verletzt.

translation.en: I mean, if he was in that chair, what would you have done to him?
translation.de: Würde er in dem Stuhl sitzen, was hättest du getan?

translation.en: I find your comparison in very bad taste.
I find your lack of common sympathy to be in the worst taste imaginable.
translation.de: Und dein fehlendes Mitgefühl ist noch viel geschmackloser.

translation.en: You and your ruling class.
I thought you were different, but you're not.
You make people work for £2 a week or starve.
translation.de: Deine Leuten können 2 £ verdienen oder verhungern.

translation.en: It's not ruling, Clifford.
That's bullying.
Come on in, then.
I'm sorry.
I'm sorry for hurting you.
I don't want you for the sake of a child… Oliver.
translation.de: Ich will dich nicht wegen eines Kindes, Oliver.

translation.en: I just want you.
All right?
All right.
But Clifford has to believe that I tried to keep us together.
translation.de: Aber Clifford muss glauben, dass ich unsere Beziehung retten wollte,

translation.en: That this was his idea,
just all gone terribly wrong.
For him to give me a divorce, for us to be together,
he needs to believe that.
I just want to be with you.
translation.de: Ich will einfach bei dir sein.

translation.en: If that's what you want.
It's not about wanting, Connie. You know what I want.
translation.de: Es geht nicht ums Wollen. Du weißt, was ich will.

translation.en: I've still got to get a divorce from Bertha meself.
translation.de: Ich muss mich noch von Bertha scheiden lassen.

translation.en: What happened with Bertha?
I went off to war, she carried on with other men.
translation.de: Ich war im Krieg, sie hatte andere Männer.

translation.en: And now she refuses to divorce me.
-What about her other man? -Ned?
-Mm-hmm. -He's a big baby of a fella.
She bullies him.
They both drink, he gets sent around here to harass me for me war pension.
translation.de: Beide trinken, und sie schickt ihn wegen der Kriegsrente her.

translation.en: Aye, let's dinna fight.
[Oliver] I'm sorry.
Why don't we just leave them all behind?
Go to Australia.
Go somewhere…
Anywhere.
-The three of us? -Just our family.
No one would judge us.
Seems a wrong and bitter thing to be bringing a child into this world.
translation.de: Es scheint falsch, ein Kind auf diese Welt zu bringen.

translation.en: -You don't mean that. -I do.
-No. -No, I mean this world here.
I'm pleased for us.
I'm pleased for you to be pleased.
translation.de: Ich freue mich, dass du dich freust.

translation.en: But when I think about around here, what man has done to man…
translation.de: Wenn ich daran denke, was die Menschen hier einander antun,

translation.en: …what leaders of men have done to their so-called fellow men.
translation.de: was die Anführer ihren sogenannten Mitmenschen antun.

translation.en: Reduced them to less than humanness.
Half corpses and they think about nowt but money.
translation.de: Wie Halbtote. Sie denken nur ans Geld.

translation.en: Living to make money.
But not all of us have the freedom to live life how we want.
translation.de: Aber nicht alle können so leben, wie sie wollen.

translation.en: Not all of us can do as we--
What are you doing?
[Connie] Come on!
Where is she? She's been gone for hours.
translation.de: Wo ist sie? Sie ist seit Stunden weg.

translation.en: Well, I'm sure it's just the rain that's keeping her.
translation.de: Sie hat sicher Schutz vorm Regen gesucht.

translation.en: She's… she's probably sheltering in the hut.
translation.de: Sie ist bestimmt in der Hütte.

translation.en: -I'll send Warren and Betts to find her. -No, don't you do that.
translation.de: -Ich schicke Warren und Betts. -Nein, lasst das.

translation.en: It'll only get people talking.
I'll slip over to the hut and, uh, see if she's there.
translation.de: Ich gehe zur Hütte und sehe mal nach.

translation.en: -What? And leave me here alone? -Oh, don't you worry.
We'll be back in no time.
-Ayup. -Ayup.
-Ayup, me duck. -Ayup, me duck.
I leave for Venice on Thursday.
I'll come by the cottage that night.
translation.de: Ich komme am Abend zum Cottage.

translation.en: [Mrs. Bolton] Milady?
Oh, milady, there you are.
Sir Clifford asked me to look for you. He was worried something had happened.
translation.de: Sir Clifford wollte, dass ich Euch suche. Er sorgte sich.

translation.en: No. No, I was sheltering in the hut from the rain.
translation.de: Ich suchte Schutz vorm Regen in der Hütte.

translation.en: Your Ladyship would be quite all right from here.
translation.de: Eure Ladyschaft kommt nun ohne mich aus.

translation.en: Good evening to you. Good evening to you, Your Ladyship.
I am not a child. It's monstrous that I have to be followed.
translation.de: Ich bin kein Kind. Wie ungeheuerlich, dass man mir folgt.

translation.en: My Ladyship, don't say that.
Sir Clifford was sure you'd been struck by lightning.
translation.de: Sir Clifford dachte, der Blitz hätte Euch getroffen.

translation.en: It's not your fault. It's foolish of Clifford to worry.
translation.de: Sie sind nicht schuld. Es war töricht von Clifford.

translation.en: Well, let's go home now.
And I'll take care of the rest.
You don't need to send the servants out after me.
translation.de: Du brauchst keine Diener nach mir zu schicken.

translation.en: [Clifford] God, where have you been?
You've been gone out hours, and in a storm like this.
translation.de: Du warst Stunden weg, in so einem Sturm.

translation.en: What have you been doing?
translation.de: -Was hast du gemacht? -Und wenn ich es dir nicht sage?

translation.en: What if I choose not to tell you? I went to the hut and lit a fire.
translation.de: -Was hast du gemacht? -Und wenn ich es dir nicht sage? Ich war in der Hütte.

translation.en: -Look at you. The state of your hair. -I went out into the rain… naked.
translation.de: -Sieh dich an. Deine Haare. -Ich war im Regen. Nackt.

translation.en: [sputtering] Are you mad?
Suppose Mellors had seen you while you were prancing with nothing on.
translation.de: Was, wenn Mellors dich gesehen hätte?

translation.en: Yes… suppose he had.
You're right, Clifford. I should really go and get cleaned up.
translation.de: Du hast recht, Clifford. Ich mache mich besser sauber.

translation.en: [Clifford] Connie!
[Connie] My sister's here!
-[Hilda] It's so good to see you. -It's been too long.
[Hilda] Good to see you.
[Connie] You know I've met someone, don't you?
I gathered from your letters, yes.
I tried to tell myself it was nothing. I tried to stay away. I did.
translation.de: Ich versuchte mir einzureden, es sei nichts.

translation.en: But I can't.
He…
I really love him.
-Wow. -And-- I know.
And I said I would stay with him tonight. I promised.
translation.de: Ich versprach, heute Abend bei ihm zu sein.

translation.en: Are you going to tell me who he is?
translation.de: Sagst du mir, wer es ist?

translation.en: He's our gamekeeper.
[hesitates] No, Hilda. He's lovely.
Honestly, he has such an understanding and tenderness.
translation.de: Er ist so verständnisvoll und zärtlich.

translation.en: He's quite the exception, you'll see.
I long hoped you would find someone else.
translation.de: Ich hoffte, du findest einen anderen.

translation.en: -But one of Clifford's servants? -I'm not giving him up!
translation.de: -Aber Cliffords Diener? -Ich gebe ihn nicht auf!

translation.en: [scoffs] Listen to you. It's you and that German boy all over again.
translation.de: Hör dich an. Es ist genau wie damals mit dem Deutschen.

translation.en: -It's not, Hilda! It's nothing like that! -Yes, it is!
Confusing sex with love, and then thinking it can continue
translation.de: Du verwechselst Sex mit Liebe und glaubst, es geht weiter,

translation.en: just because it's what you want.
Please, come to Venice and take the time to think through what you really want.
translation.de: Komm mit nach Venedig und denk drüber nach, was du wirklich willst.

translation.en: I know what I want!
-Really? -Yes!
And I'm seeing him tonight or I'm not going to Venice. I can't!
translation.de: Und ich sehe ihn heute Abend oder ich reise nicht ab!

translation.en: I really thought that you, of all people, would understand!
translation.de: Ich dachte, gerade du würdest es verstehen!

translation.en: Goodbye.
-Bye. -I look forward to your letters.
You have a good time, and then come back and cheer us up.
translation.de: Amüsiert Euch und kommt zurück und heitert uns auf.

translation.en: I will. Take care.
This is my sister, Hilda.
-[Oliver] Hello. -Hilda, this is Oliver Mellors.
-Hello. -Pleasure to meet you.
Take a seat then.
[Connie] Hilda.
What do you want me to say?
Whatever it is you're thinking.
Very well.
It is one thing to hold trysts in your cottage,
translation.de: Ein Stelldichein in Ihrem Cottage ist eine Sache,

translation.en: but what happens when you go out into the world?
translation.de: aber was passiert, wenn ihr euch zeigt?

translation.en: When Connie's friends cross the street to avoid her.
translation.de: Wenn Connies Freunde sie auf der Straße meiden?

translation.en: That's not fair.
She's got me figured out, then, eh?
What summed me up so quick? Were it summat I said?
translation.de: So schnell? War es etwas, das ich gesagt habe?

translation.en: How do you expect to take care of her once you've lost your job?
translation.de: Wie wollen Sie sich um sie kümmern, ohne Ihre Stelle?

translation.en: Do you actually believe you can give her a chance at happiness?
translation.de: Glauben Sie wirklich, Sie können sie glücklich machen?

translation.en: Oh, you're asking the wrong person there.
translation.de: Da fragt Ihr die falsche Person.

translation.en: All I know is I get a great deal of happiness from her.
translation.de: Ich weiß nur, dass sie mich glücklich macht.

translation.en: -Thought of your own happiness at least. -Hilda, enough!
I think you understand far better than she does how badly this could end, Mr. Mellors.
translation.de: Ich glaube, Sie verstehen besser als sie, wie schlimm das enden könnte.

translation.en: Think about how much she really means to you.
translation.de: Wie viel bedeutet sie Ihnen wirklich?

translation.en: I'll pick you up in the morning, Connie. Early.
translation.de: Ich hole dich morgen ab, Connie. Zeitig.

translation.en: Don't keep me waiting.
-Mr. Mellors. -[Connie] Hilda.
I'm so sorry. I shouldn't have brought her.
translation.de: Tut mir leid. Ich hätte sie nicht herbringen sollen.

translation.en: Please don't let her upset you.
She's just protective.
She's right.
We haven't thought beyond tomorrow, have we?
translation.de: Wir haben nicht über morgen hinaus gedacht.

translation.en: Sir Clifford will fight this divorce. He'll fight to keep our child.
translation.de: Sir Clifford erlaubt die Scheidung nicht. Er wird um unser Kind kämpfen.

translation.en: I never had to think about these things until you turned up.
translation.de: Ich musste nie an so was denken, bevor du auftauchtest.

translation.en: Let's go upstairs.
Yeah, that's good. That's good.
-[gasping, moaning] -Yes.
The fuck are you playing at, Ned?
Calm down, Mellors. I'm not here to fight. Bertha sent me.
translation.de: Ruhig, Mellors. Ich will nicht streiten. Bertha schickt mich.

translation.en: She's your problem now. Not mine.
translation.de: Sie ist jetzt dein Problem. Nicht meins.

translation.en: Ain't how she sees it.
She's still your wife, entitled to half your military pension.
translation.de: Als deine Frau hat sie Anspruch auf die halbe Kriegsrente.

translation.en: Aye, and I'm entitled to a divorce. I won't get one, will I?
translation.de: Und ich habe Anspruch auf eine Scheidung.

translation.en: -Fuck off, then. -[Flossie growling]
-All right. I'm going. -[Flossie barks]
[Ned] I'm going.
[Connie] Is he gone?
Unless his heart's just given out running.
translation.de: Wenn sein Pferd nicht allein weg ist.

translation.en: Stay there till we know he's gone.
translation.de: Bleib da, bis wir sicher sind.

translation.en: -[car horn honks] -Oh, what is she thinking?
Go on.
[Hilda] Connie.
For heaven's sake, Connie.
We're going to Venice tomorrow. Do you have to look so miserable?
translation.de: Wir fahren morgen nach Venedig. Musst du so traurig gucken?

translation.en: I think I'm pregnant.
Right.
I assume it's not Clifford's.
No.
Although, he did say he would be happy for me to have a child with another man.
translation.de: Aber er sagte, ein Kind von einem anderen wäre ihm recht.

translation.en: -Seriously? -Mm-hmm.
I don't know how much longer I can do this.
translation.de: Ich halte das nicht mehr aus.

translation.en: What exactly?
What's happened?
I'm in love with someone
other than Clifford.
So you've taken a lover?
Well, good.
Do I know the man?
[scoffs] No.
But I think I… want a divorce from Clifford.
translation.de: Aber ich möchte mich von Clifford scheiden lassen.

translation.en: [Sir Malcolm] Because of your feelings for this other man?
translation.de: Wegen deiner Gefühle für den anderen.

translation.en: Well, if you want my opinion… [sighs]
translation.de: Wenn du meine Meinung wissen willst,

translation.en: I'm sorry, but you stand to gain very little by breaking things off.
translation.de: mit einer Scheidung wirst du nicht viel erreichen.

translation.en: Feelings come and go.
You may love one man this year and another the next, but the world will go on.
translation.de: Du liebst morgen vielleicht einen anderen, aber das Leben geht weiter.

translation.en: And Wragby will go on standing.
Please yourself,
but stick by Wragby.
And Wragby will stick by you.
Let's go to Venice, shall we?
[Ned] He comes back home thinking he's better than the lot of us.
translation.de: Er kommt zurück und denkt, er ist besser als alle.

translation.en: Gets the world to think poor Bertha's to blame for all their trouble,
translation.de: Er macht alle glauben, Bertha sei an allem schuld,

translation.en: and then he refuses to support her.
-[man] Bloody disgrace. -I know.
Bertha goes to the cottage today, trying to patch things up.
translation.de: Bertha geht heute zu ihm, um das zu klären.

translation.en: Makes sense.
She found them silk nightclothes in the fire.
No wonder he keeps to himself. He's hiding a woman in there.
translation.de: Kein Wunder. Er versteckt dort eine Frau.

translation.en: Lady Chatterley loans her gamekeeper a book,
translation.de: Lady Chatterley leiht ihm ein Buch und nun wird ihr nachgesagt…

translation.en: and she's accused of… Sorry, that's outrageous.
translation.de: Lady Chatterley leiht ihm ein Buch und nun wird ihr nachgesagt… Das ist unerhört.

translation.en: [woman] Of course it is. I won't breathe another word on the subject.
translation.de: Natürlich. Ich sage kein Wort mehr.

translation.en: [woman 2] Everyone's talking about it. You know how people gossip.
Sir, no one wants to have this conversation,
but we must.
[Linley] And of course, it's pure nonsense.
But your gamekeeper seems to inspire all manner of rumors.
translation.de: Aber Euer Wildhüter sorgt für Gerüchte.

translation.en: The sooner you pack him off, the better.
translation.de: Je eher er geht, desto besser.

translation.en: [Clifford] I appreciate you coming to me with this. Your concerns are noted.
translation.de: Danke, dass Sie Ihre Besorgnis mit mir teilen.

translation.en: Hello… [hesitates]
I'd like a London number, please.
Lady Chatterley.
-Ayuh, Mrs. Bolton. -Good day.
I hear Sir Clifford's asking for me.
Of course, yes. He's in his study.
Right, aye.
I called Her Ladyship, and she's coming back.
-When? -This evening.
As soon as she can get here.
She said you could meet at the hut and decide what to do.
translation.de: Sie können sich in der Hütte treffen und entscheiden.

translation.en: There's…
There's dark days coming, Mrs. Bolton.
translation.de: Es kommen dunkle Zeiten auf uns zu, Mrs. Bolton.

translation.en: Best to steer clear from it all.
[Clifford] Come in.
You are my servant,
living upon my land at my sole discretion,
translation.de: Sie leben nur auf meinen Wunsch auf meinem Land.

translation.en: and now your indecencies have become the subject of gossip.
translation.de: Und jetzt redet man über Ihre Schamlosigkeit.

translation.en: You should shut the mouths of the gossips--
Are you aware that Lady Chatterley's name has been slandered?
Apparently, her name was inscribed in a book found at the cottage.
translation.de: Ihr Buch wurde offenbar im Cottage gefunden.

translation.en: I've got a picture of Queen Mary on me wall calendar.
translation.de: Ich habe ein Bild von Queen Mary.

translation.en: I suppose she's in my harem as well.
translation.de: Ist sie auch in meinem Harem?

translation.en: I do not appreciate your sarcasm, Mellors.
You have until the end of today,
translation.de: Sie haben bis zum Abend Zeit.

translation.en: after which time I never want to see you set foot upon my land again.
translation.de: Danach will ich Sie nie wieder auf meinem Land sehen.

translation.en: -Do I make myself clear? -Oh, perfectly.
I better get packing then.
Mrs. Flint. Mrs. Flint, excuse me.
-I have to get Josephine to bed. -I know you've heard things.
Please, I can't do this. We lease this farm from Sir Clifford.
translation.de: Ich kann nicht. Wir mieten die Farm von Sir Clifford.

translation.en: And you always will.
You met him here, didn't you? The day he came to get milk?
translation.de: Ihr habt ihn hier getroffen. Als er Milch holte.

translation.en: -I thought you'd come to see us. -Of course I did.
I found where you parked the car in the trees.
translation.de: Ich sah Euer Auto in den Bäumen.

translation.en: -No, that was one time. -I don't want to know.
translation.de: -Das war einmal. -Ich will es nicht wissen.

translation.en: Good evening, Lady Chatterley.
[Connie] What are you doing? Where are you going?
translation.de: Was machst du? Wohin gehst du?

translation.en: The cat is well and truly out of the bag now, Connie.
translation.de: Die Katze ist jetzt aus dem Sack.

translation.en: Everybody's talking.
I've been sacked.
You cannot be seen here, Connie. You need to be in Venice.
translation.de: Man darf dich hier nicht sehen. Fahr nach Venedig.

translation.en: -But we could just leave together. Now. -Look at me.
translation.de: -Wir könnten zusammen weg. Jetzt. -Sieh mich doch an.

translation.en: I have nothing to give you.
I've no job. I've no home. I've no purpose in life. Nothing.
translation.de: Keine Arbeit, kein Zuhause. Keine Ziele im Leben.

translation.en: Don't say that.
You are everything to me.
[man] Mellors!
You need to go!
-Look at me. -Shh.
Promise me, promise me we'll share our lives.
-Aye. -Promise.
Aye, me lass.
When the time comes. When the time comes.
-[man] Mellors! -[Oliver] Oh…
Ayuh, can I grab me coat, mate, or…
translation.de: Ayuh, ich hole ja schon meine Jacke…

translation.en: I'll find you.
Wherever you are, I'll find you.
-My Ladyship, you shouldn't be here. -No, Mrs. Bolton.
translation.de: -Ihr solltet nicht hier sein. -Nein, Mrs. Bolton.

translation.en: [Clifford] Connie.
It's all true.
Why would you do this?
-It was your idea. -My idea? No, no, no.
Clifford, you knew perfectly well what I was getting into.
translation.de: Du wusstest genau, was ich treibe.

translation.en: With the right sort of man. I said the right sort!
translation.de: Ich sagte, mit der richtigen Art von Mann!

translation.en: Oliver Mellors is a better person than anyone I've ever met.
translation.de: Ich habe nie einen besseren Menschen als Oliver Mellors gekannt.

translation.en: I was perfectly clear, Connie.
-We discussed the rules. -I'm going to have his child.
translation.de: -Du kennst die Regeln. -Ich bekomme sein Kind.

translation.en: You're going to--
You're sure?
But… everybody knows.
You can't possibly expect me to claim that child as mine now.
translation.de: Du erwartest nicht, dass ich das Kind als meines ausrufe.

translation.en: No, I…
I don't.
I don't.
I want a divorce, Clifford.
I'm leaving you.
No. No, you can't.
Look, I'm… I'm so sorry about how this has all turned out,
translation.de: Das alles tut mir so schrecklich leid,

translation.en: but we both know that this… marriage has been very unhappy for a very long time now.
translation.de: aber wir führen seit Langem eine unglückliche Ehe.

translation.en: It hasn't been. It hasn't been. Not for me.
Well, yes.
Because you laid out all the rules.
And I tried to follow them.
I tried to support you in every way I could.
translation.de: Ich unterstützte dich, so gut ich konnte.

translation.en: [voice shaking] But you gave me nothing in return.
translation.de: Aber du gabst mir nichts zurück.

translation.en: Not the slightest drop of affection or kindness.
translation.de: Nicht das geringste Bisschen Zuneigung oder Güte.

translation.en: And what's worse, you made me feel ashamed for even wanting those things.
translation.de: Und du beschämtest mich, wenn ich diese Dinge wollte.

translation.en: I've always cared for you, Connie.
translation.de: Ich habe mich immer um dich gekümmert.

translation.en: Yes, cared for me.
In the same way you care for your books and for your radio,
translation.de: Wie du dich um deine Bücher und dein Radio kümmerst,

translation.en: but never in the ways I need you to.
translation.de: aber nicht so, wie ich es brauche.

translation.en: [Clifford] I love you, Connie.
I've loved you the only way I know how.
translation.de: Auf die einzige Art, die ich kenne.

translation.en: I've given you everything I know how to give.
translation.de: Ich gab dir alles, was ich zu geben wusste.

translation.en: It's not enough.
Then talk to me, Con.
Help me understand.
Show me how I can prove to you how I feel.
translation.de: Zeig mir, wie ich dir meine Gefühle beweisen kann.

translation.en: Let me go.
Please.
Let me go.
Go.
Though know this.
I will never grant you your divorce.
translation.de: Ich werde einer Scheidung niemals einwilligen.

translation.en: Because you broke your word.
Because you've made a mockery of my life here in Wragby.
translation.de: Du hast mein Leben auf Wragby zum Gespött gemacht.

translation.en: I am not inclined to give you anything ever again.
translation.de: Ich habe nicht vor, dir je wieder etwas zu geben.

translation.en: I don't think you ever really were.
Milady.
I wasn't meaning to pry, but I worried about you.
translation.de: Ich wollte nicht lauschen. Ich sorge mich.

translation.en: I'm all right. [sighs]
Listen.
You have no idea where Mellors has gone?
translation.de: Sie wissen nicht, wo Mellors ist?

translation.en: No.
Would you ask your friends to let you know if they hear any news?
translation.de: Würden Sie Ihre Freundinnen um Neuigkeiten bitten?

translation.en: And why shall I say I'm asking?
Because I love him.
-Tell them that. -Yes, milady.
Milady…
I do hope you find your gentleman.
translation.de: Ich hoffe, Ihr findet Euren Gentleman.

translation.en: Thank you, Mrs. Bolton.
So do I.
[woman 1] It's all true, then?
Has Her Ladyship left Sir Clifford?
Her Ladyship has asked
that you will pass along any news of Mr. Mellors.
translation.de: dass ihr Neuigkeiten von Mr. Mellors weitergebt.

translation.en: "'Cause I love him," she said.
She gave up everything for him.
translation.de: Sie gab alles für ihn auf.

translation.en: Her title, her wealth, her position in the world.
translation.de: Ihren Titel, ihr Vermögen, ihre Stellung in der Welt.

translation.en: Now she's lost him.
I'll not hear a word spoken against them.
translation.de: Ich will kein Wort gegen die beiden hören.

translation.en: This is a love story.
This place is losing its charm, don't you think?
translation.de: Dieser Ort hat seinen Charme verloren.

translation.en: What?
Let's go back to London.
All right.
I'm Connie Reid. I don't think we met.
translation.de: Ich bin Connie Reid. Sehr erfreut.

translation.en: Have a lovely evening.
How many times have you read that page?
translation.de: Wie oft hast du die Seite gelesen?

translation.en: What?
Well… it looks as though he's found you.
-Oh my God. -Yes.
You'll want my car again, I imagine.
[Oliver] You'll be impressed to learn that word of your departure from Wragby
translation.de: Ich habe von deinem Auszug von Wragby

translation.en: has made it all the way to my little village in Scotland.
translation.de: sogar in meinem Dorf in Schottland gehört.

translation.en: A man came to work in the local mines, brought the tale with him,
translation.de: Ein Bergmann brachte die Neuigkeiten mit,

translation.en: telling everyone in the pub about a lady who fell for a hired man
translation.de: eine Dame hätte sich in einen Bediensteten verliebt.

translation.en: and didn't care if the world knew it because… she loved him.
translation.de: Ihr war es egal, ob die Welt es wusste, weil sie ihn liebte.

translation.en: Names weren't used, of course.
I was simply "the gamekeeper."
You were the "Lady in love."
Excuse me, I'm looking for Oliver Mellors.
Do you… Do you know him?
[man] Oh yes, I do.
He's down that road.
Thank you. Thank you so much!
[Oliver] It was a good story, and I found myself wondering if there might be more to the tale.
translation.de: Es war eine gute Geschichte, und ich wollte wissen, ob sie wahr ist.

translation.en: A feller I knew from the army got me work at a farm here.
translation.de: Ich fand Arbeit auf einer Farm.

translation.en: Thirty shillings a week and decent lodgings in a cottage up the road.
translation.de: 30 Schilling die Woche und ein hübsches Cottage.

translation.en: I thought I needed a purpose before bringing you and a child into my life.
translation.de: Ich wollte erst einen Sinn, dann eine Familie mit dir.

translation.en: [Oliver] I can't say I've found any greater meaning here on the farm,
translation.de: Auf der Farm habe ich keinen größeren Sinn gefunden,

translation.en: but I've made a home.
I can't imagine what you've already been through
and how much you've already given up.
You'd be giving up even more to come live here with me,
translation.de: Du würdest noch mehr aufgeben, für ein Leben hier mit mir, aber…

translation.en: [Oliver] …what we have… together
is different than anything I've ever known.
translation.de: ist anders als alles, was ich je kannte.

translation.en: There's a little flame between us. It's always burning.
translation.de: Zwischen uns brennt eine ewige Flamme.

translation.en: And I've come to believe that tending a fire like that is…
translation.de: Und ich glaube, so ein Feuer zu hegen,

translation.en: purpose enough for any life.
translation.de: ist Sinn genug für jedes Leben.
